some weeks cold looks, cold words and
colder consolations: but I escaped; they
tried to bind th me with fetters that
they thought silken, yet which
weighed on me like iron, although
I broke them more easily than a
girth formed of a single straw and
fled to freedom.
The few weeks that I spent in
London were the most miserable
of my life: A great city is a frightful
habitation to one sorrowing. The
sunset and the gentle moon, the
blessed motion of the leaves and the
murmuring of waters are all sweet
physicians to a distempered mind. The
soul is expanded and drinks in quiet
and l, a lulling medecine – to me
it was as the sight of the lovely
water snakes to the bewitched mari
